query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 La gloria di colui che tutto move 2 per l’universo penetra, e risplende 3 in una parte più e meno altrove.
query.result: 1 The glory of he who moves everything 2 through the universe penetrates, and shines 3 in a part more and less elsewhere

4 In the sky that takes more of its light 5 was I, and I saw things that to speak again 6 nor knows nor can he who descends from up there;
7 because drawing himself to his desire, 8 our intellect deepens itself so much, 9 that behind memory cannot go.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Veramente quant’ io del regno santo 11 ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, 12 sarà ora materia del mio canto.
query.result: 10 Truly how much I of the holy kingdom 11 in my mind could make a treasure, 12 will now be material of my song.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro 14 fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, 15 come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro.
query.result: 13 O good Apollo, to the last work 14 make me of your valor such a made vessel, 15 as you ask to give the beloved laurel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso 17 assai mi fu; ma or con amendue 18 m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso.
query.result: 16 Up to here the one yoke of Parnassus 17 it was much to me; but now with both 18 I must enter into the remaining aringa

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 19 Enter into my chest, and breathe yours 20 just as when Marsïa you drew 21 from the vagina of her limbs

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 O divina virtù, se mi ti presti 23 tanto che l’ombra del beato regno 24 segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
25 vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno 26 venire, e coronarmi de le foglie 27 che la materia e tu mi farai degno.
query.result:
22 O divine virtue, if you lend yourself to me 23 so much that the shade of the blessed kingdom 24 marked in my head I manifest,
25 will see me at the foot of your delightful wood 26 to come, and crown me with the leaves 27 that the matter and you will make me worthy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie 29 per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, 30 colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,

query.result:
28 So rare times, father, if one catches it 29 to triumph or Caesar or poet, 30 blame and shame of human desires,
31 that gives birth to joy upon the happy 32 delphic deity should the leaf 33 penal, when some of itself is thirsty.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda: 35 forse di retro a me con miglior voci 36 si pregherà perché Cirra risponda.
query.result: 34 Little spark great flame second: 35 perhaps from behind to me with better voices 36 it will pray that Cirra answer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result:

Please translate each line literally into English.
49 E sì come secondo raggio suole 50 uscir del primo e risalire in suso, 51 pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
52 così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso 53 ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, 54 e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso.
query.result:

55 Molto è licito là, che qui non lece 56 a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco 57 fatto per proprio de l’umana spece.
query.result: 55 Much is lawful there, that here does not offend 56 to our virtues, thanks of the place 57 made for the own of the human species

query.prompt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti 74 novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, 75 tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti.
query.result: 73 If I were only of myself that which you created 74 anew, love that the heaven governs, 75 you know it, that with your light you lifted me.

query.prompt:

76 When the wheel that you eternally 77 desired, made me wait for it 78 with the harmony that you temper and discern,
